intro: Rourea ealaensis, commonly known as the Eala's rourea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is typically found in humid, lowland forests and thrives in partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
